title: K'ril Tsutsaroth

To gain access to his chamber, players must have slain 40 Zamorakians throughout the dungeon. He uses melee and magic attacks, and his special attack can occasionally hit through the Protect from Melee prayer should players attempt to use it.

K'ril Tsutsaroth (pronounced "KRILL TUTT-zee-roth"[1]) is the boss of the Zamorak Fortress in the God Wars Dungeon. To gain access to his chamber, players must have slain 40 Zamorakians throughout the dungeon. He uses melee and magic attacks, and his special attack can occasionally hit through the Protect from Melee prayer should players attempt to use it.

He is typically killed on a Slayer task - K'ril Tsutsaroth is classified as a greater demon, and thus killing him counts towards any greater demon Slayer task and allows a player to take advantage of the damage boosting effects of a Black mask or Slayer helmet. As a demon, he is also susceptible to Arclight's passive effect.

K'ril is the least popular of all of the God Wars bosses, as his unique drops (namely the Zamorak hilt) do not have as much value compared to the other generals. A trip is also more tedious: his prayer smashes can quickly drain a tanking player's supplies and players cannot use bones to peaches tabs to extend their trip as he and his bodyguards all drop ashes instead of bones.

Location[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Spawns Map
God Wars Dungeon (Zamorak boss room)6501Maplink

Fight overview[edit | edit source]

Main article: K'ril Tsutsaroth/Strategies
A group of players fighting K'ril Tsutsaroth and his bodyguards.

Like other God Wars Dungeon bosses, K'ril roams around a rectangular room with his bodyguards until a player enters, attacking them on sight. He attacks with melee and magic, and if his target is praying Protect from Melee, he can use a devastating melee special attack that hits through prayer. The melee attack has a maximum hit of 46, the magic attack hits from 10-30[2] and the special attack hits from 35-49[3], as well as draining half of the player's current prayer points. The relative occurrences of the attacks are 2/3 for melee and 1/3 for magic. Barring a complex mechanic, K'ril will use his special on 1 in every 9 hits instead of a melee attack, which gives it an incidence of 2/27 in total.[4] If all players leave, his health and stats will be reset.

Bodyguards[edit | edit source]

  • Balfrug Kreeyath (Magic)
  • Tstanon Karlak (Melee)
  • Zakl'n Gritch (Ranged)

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 15,111 kills from the Drop Rate Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average K'ril Tsutsaroth kill, including its unique drops, is worth 132,557. Excluding the unique drops, the average kill is worth 17,028. Furthermore killing the three minions yields an additional 13,609 on average (including uniques), bringing the total to 146,167 per kill.

Rare drop table[edit | edit source]

There is an 8/127 chance of rolling the God Wars Dungeon-variant rare drop table and a 2/127 chance of rolling the God Wars Dungeon-variant gem drop table.[9] This table differs from the regular rare drop table and gem drop table in a few ways. This table is unaffected by the Ring of wealth.[10] The Runite bar drop is replaced by a Rune sword. The quantity range of some items differs. All empty rolls (1/2.70) are replaced by a coin drop of 19,500-20,000; however the chance of rolling these coins is included in the monster's main drop table and is not displayed here for the sake of clarity.

Combat Achievements[edit | edit source]

The following Combat Achievement tasks involve K'ril Tsutsaroth.

Name Description Difficulty Category
K'ril Tsutsaroth Adept Kill K'ril Tsutsaroth 50 times. Hard Kill count
Yarr No More Receive kill-credit for K'ril Tsutsaroth without him using his special attack. Hard Mechanical
Demonic Showdown Finish off K'ril Tsutsaroth whilst all of his bodyguards are dead. Hard Mechanical
Demonbane Weaponry II Finish off K'ril Tsutsaroth with a demonbane weapon. Hard Restriction
K'ril Tsutsaroth Veteran Kill K'ril Tsutsaroth 100 times. Elite Kill count
The Bane of Demons Defeat K'ril Tsutsaroth in a privately rented instance using only demonbane spells. Elite Mechanical
Demonic Defence Kill K'ril Tsutsaroth in a privately rented instance without taking any of his melee hits. Elite Perfection
Demon Whisperer Kill K'ril Tsutsaroth in a privately rented instance without ever being hit by his bodyguards. Grandmaster Perfection
Ash Collector Kill K'ril Tsutsaroth 20 times in a privately rented instance without leaving the room. Grandmaster Stamina

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
16 June 2021
(update | poll)

K'ril Tsutsaroth now drops infernal ashes in place of regular ashes.

13 January 2021
(update)

Ironmen now have their own shared instance for each God Wars Dungeon general. The "Peek" option on doors will now tell players how many players are in the ironman instance. Ironmen can also observe the brazier outside the room to check if the shared ironman instance is empty. If the brazier is lit the instance is in use.

25 June 2015
(update | poll)

Added a 'peek' option to the entrance of this boss, allowing players to see the number of other players currently in the boss room.

17 July 2014
(update | poll)

Players can now receive a pet version of this boss after defeating it.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • K'ril was classified as a lesser demon during development. He was reclassified as a greater demon when the God Wars Dungeon was released on 17 October 2013.

'''K'ril Tsutsaroth''' (pronounced ''"KRILL TUTT-zee-roth"''{{CiteGeneral|url=http://services.runescape.com/m=rswiki/en/Pronunciation_Guide|title=Pronunciation Guide|accessdate=2022-4-21|author=Jagex|archiveurl=https://chisel.weirdgloop.org/oldwiki/archive1/services.runescape.com/m%3drswiki/en/Pronunciation_Guide.html|archivedate=2016-07-31}}) is the boss of the [[Zamorak Fortress]] in the [[God Wars Dungeon]]. To gain access to his chamber, players must have slain 40 Zamorakians throughout the dungeon. He uses [[melee]] and [[magic]] attacks, and his special attack can occasionally hit through the [[Protect from Melee]] prayer should players attempt to use it.

He is typically killed on a [[Slayer task]] - K'ril Tsutsaroth is classified as a [[greater demon]], and thus killing him counts towards any greater demon Slayer task and allows a player to take advantage of the damage boosting effects of a [[Black mask]] or [[Slayer helmet]]. As a demon, he is also susceptible to [[Arclight]]'s passive effect.

K'ril is the least popular of all of the [[God Wars]] bosses, as his unique drops (namely the [[Zamorak hilt]]) do not have as much value compared to the other generals. A trip is also more tedious: his [[prayer]] smashes can quickly drain a tanking player's supplies and players cannot use [[bones to peaches]] tabs to extend their trip as he and his bodyguards all drop ashes instead of bones.

==Fight overview==
{{Main|K'ril Tsutsaroth/Strategies}}
[[File:Fighting K'ril Tsutsaroth.png|thumb|300px|A group of players fighting K'ril Tsutsaroth and his bodyguards.]]
Like other God Wars Dungeon bosses, K'ril roams around a rectangular room with his bodyguards until a player enters, attacking them on sight. He attacks with melee and magic, and if his target is praying [[Protect from Melee]], he can use a devastating melee special attack that hits through prayer. The melee attack has a maximum hit of 46, the magic attack hits from 10-30{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1055016564595011585|date=24 October 2018|archiveurl=https://archive.is/z0Y5o|archivedate=26 May 2020|quote=Zilyana has a 10-20 attack and K'ril has a 10-30 attack.}} and the special attack hits from 35-49{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1247599267910467584|date=7 April 2020|archiveurl=https://archive.is/RSH4O|archivedate=26 May 2020|quote=Its damage is random, 35-49 inclusive, even distribution across those numbers.}}, as well as draining half of the player's current prayer points. The relative occurrences of the attacks are 2/3 for melee and 1/3 for magic. Barring a complex mechanic, K'ril will use his special on 1 in every 9 hits instead of a melee attack, which gives it an incidence of 2/27 in total.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1247602346496004096|date=7 April 2020|archiveurl=https://archive.is/CFZMo|archivedate=26 May 2020|quote=The melee one looks more like a 2/3 to me, from the code, but the enraged attack would be part of that too, so it'd be less than 2/3 in practice.}}
If all players leave, his health and stats will be reset.

===Bodyguards===
*[[Balfrug Kreeyath]] ([[Magic]])
*[[Tstanon Karlak]] ([[Melee]])
*[[Zakl'n Gritch]] ([[Ranged]])

(10/127) * 1 * {{GWDRDTValue}}
}}}}<!--

(1/127) * (124/127) * 1350 +
(1/127) * (9/12) * 1350 +
(1/127) * (1/12) * 1 * {{GEP|Godsword shard 1}} +
(1/127) * (1/12) * 1 * {{GEP|Godsword shard 2}} +
(1/127) * (1/12) * 1 * {{GEP|Godsword shard 3}} +

(8/127) * 7.5 * {{GEP|Death rune}} +
(8/127) * 7.5 * {{GEP|Blood rune}} +

(8/127) * 2 * {{GEP|Tuna potato}} +
(7/127) * 97.5 * {{GEP|Steel arrow}} +
(66/127) * 1350 +
(8/127) * 7.5 * {{GEP|Wine of zamorak}} +
(2/127) * 1 * {{GEP|Super attack(3)}} +
(2/127) * 1 * {{GEP|Super strength(3)}}
}}}}

The average K'ril Tsutsaroth kill, including its unique drops, is worth {{Coins|floor({{#var:onekrilLoot}}+{{#var:krilUnique}})}}. Excluding the unique drops, the average kill is worth {{Coins|floor({{#var:onekrilLoot}})}}. Furthermore killing the three minions yields an additional {{Coins|floor(3*{{#var:onekrilminionLoot}})}} on average (including uniques), bringing the total to {{Coins|floor({{#var:onekrilLoot}}+{{#var:krilUnique}}+3*{{#var:onekrilminionLoot}})}} per kill.

{{Subject changes
|date = 16 June 2021
|update = A Kingdom Divided
|poll = A Kingdom Divided
|change = K'ril Tsutsaroth now drops [[infernal ashes]] in place of regular ashes.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 13 January 2021
|update = God Wars Instancing and Soul Wars Improvements
|change = Ironmen now have their own shared instance for each God Wars Dungeon general. The "Peek" option on doors will now tell players how many players are in the ironman instance. Ironmen can also observe the brazier outside the room to check if the shared ironman instance is empty. If the brazier is lit the instance is in use. 
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 25 June 2015
|update = Boss Room Counters & Platinum Tokens
|poll = Old School Content Poll 34: XP droplets & Slayer
|change = Added a 'peek' option to the entrance of this boss, allowing players to see the number of other players currently in the boss room. 
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 17 July 2014
|update = Boss Pets and Spawn Rates
|poll = Old School feature poll - Content Poll 22
|change = Players can now receive a pet version of this boss after defeating it.
}}

==Trivia==
*K'ril was classified as a [[lesser demon]] during development. He was reclassified as a [[greater demon]] when the [[God Wars Dungeon]] was released on [[17 October]] [[2013]].
